intro: Schoenoplectiella hotarui, commonly known as the Hotaru Island sedge, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that develop in spikelets. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
